definition: prop/support (for weight)/rest (e.g. arm rest)/thanks to/to hold in one's hand/to support in one's palm/to give/to base/to commit/to set/torr (unit of pressure)
to trust/to entrust/to be entrusted with/to act as trustee

sentences.english: The act was supported by both Whigs and Tories.
sentences.chinese: 辉格党和托利党都支持该法案。

sentences.english: It's a dead certainty that the Tories will be re-elected.
sentences.chinese: 这事确信无疑，托利党将进行重新选举。

sentences.english: And the Tory manifesto in particular is a stunning gamble.
sentences.chinese: 尤其是托利党的宣言，是一长令人瞠目的赌博。

sentences.english: Of course, there is time for the Tories to fluff it.
sentences.chinese: 当然，托利党要犯错，也有的是时间。

sentences.english: His accomplishment has been to make them electable.
sentences.chinese: 卡梅伦的成就使得托利党又有了候选资格。

sentences.english: The Tories and the Whigs were alternatively in power for a long time.
sentences.chinese: 长期以来，辉格党和托利党轮流掌权。

definition: Jacobin club, French revolutionary party that played a leading role in the reign of terror 1791-1794
Thatcher (name)/Baroness Thatcher or Margaret Thatcher (1925-2013), British conservative politician, prime minister 1979-1990
